key_points: Meghan McCain supports the impeachment of former President Donald Trump, citing the storming of the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6 as incitement of insurrection.
McCain emphasizes her commitment to fighting for the Republican Party and identifies herself as a lifelong conservative.
She criticized the age of current Republican members of Congress, suggesting it impacts their concern for the party's future.
The McCain family has a history of conflict with Trump, including public feuds and Cindy McCain's endorsement of Joe Biden in the presidential election.
Arizona Republican Party censured Cindy McCain for endorsing Biden over Trump in the last presidential election.
Meghan McCain defends Trump supporters against comments made by Katie Couric, who suggested they need to be 'deprogrammed'.
McCain expresses anger over the implication that all Trump supporters or conservatives are similar to extremist figures such as Marjorie Taylor Greene or Jake Angeli.
Highlights infighting within the Republican Party, especially between Reps. Matt Gaetz and Liz Cheney over Trump's impeachment.
Gaetz has called for Cheney, who voted to impeach Trump, to step down from her position.
McCain finds the internal conflicts within the GOP entertaining but unproductive.
